text: Involvement of cyclic AMP - dependent protein kinases in the signal transduction pathway for <extra_id_0> interleukin-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Expression of a highly specific protein inhibitor for cyclic AMP - dependent protein kinases in <extra_id_0> interleukin-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) - responsive cells blocked <extra_id_0> IL-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced gene transcription that was driven by the <extra_id_0> kappa immunoglobulin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> enhancer or the human immunodeficiency virus long terminal repeat .

This inhibitor did not affect protein kinase C - mediated gene transcription , suggesting that cyclic AMP - dependent protein kinases are involved in the signal transduction pathway for <extra_id_0> IL-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in a number of responsive cell types .
